cascade verb
(FALL)
[ I usually + adv/prep ] to fall quickly and in large amounts: Coins cascaded from/out of the fruit machine.

cascade verb
(INFORMATION)
[ I or T ] to pass on information by giving it to just a few people, who then give it to more people; to be passed on in this way: Guest information is cascaded through employee shift briefings. Communication cascades down the organization until the information has been communicated through each level, to the front lines.
